intro: Copiapoa cinerea subsp. columna-alba, commonly known as the White Column Copiapoa, is a cactus species native to the Atacama Desert in Chile. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stem that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces white to pale blue flowers during the cooler months, typically in spring. Its thick, ribbed structure helps it store water, adapting to the arid environment. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
